page.title: 16SWALE PUBLIC LIBRARY
page.content: The central library is in Sittingbourne and was first opened by H.E.Bates.12 full-time and 5 part-time staff are employed.There are 66,435 books:"Brittanica"has the longest word;"Who's Who"is fattest;the "London Directory"is heaviest;the latest book is "Breakdance";and the oldest book is E.Hasted on Kent.Book circulation is now controlled by a Perkins Elmer Computer using Cobal language.Three branches have video libraries but Sittingbourne does not.Specia services are offered to the housebound,for local studies,and general information.Adult members may borrow 6 books at a time,children 4. Each year 439973 books are borrowed. The most overdue book is "How to improve your memory"(old joke).Fines must be paid on overdue books.
